text: The Algeria national cycling team represents Algeria in International cycling competitions such as Olympic Games or World cycling Championships. ==Medal count== Algeria has 13 participations in the Summer Olympic of 27 editions held from 1896 to 2016. {| class="wikitable" width=40% style="font-size:90%; text-align:center;" ! rowspan=2 | Competition ! colspan=5 | Medal table |- ! width=30 | ! width=30 | ! width=30 | ! width=30 | Tot. ! width=30 | Rank |- | align=left| Summer Olympics || 0 || 0 || 0 || 0 || 0 |- | align=left| World cycling Championships || 0 || 0 || 0 || 0 || 0 |- | align=left| Mediterranean Games || 0 || 0 || 3 || 3 || 10 |- | align=left| African Games || 5 || 6 || 7 || 18 || 2 |- | align=left| African Championships || 1 || 5 || 8 || 14 || 4 |- ! align=center|Total !! 6 !! 11 !! 18 !! 35 |} == List of medalists at Mediterranean Games == {| class="wikitable" !Medal !Name !Games !Event |- | |Algeria |1975 Algiers, Algeria |Team Time Trial |- | |Farouk Hamza |1983 Casablanca, Morocco |Men's road race |- | |Abdelbasset Hannachi | 2013 Mersin,Turkey |Men's road race |} ==See also== *Algeria at the Olympics ==References== ==External links== *cycling at Summer Olympics Cycling Category:Cycling in Algeria Category:National cycling teams
title: Algeria national cycling team
